DOC.brief_summary: OPTAMI documents the characteristics of consecutive patients with acute STEMI and NSTEMI in hospital everyday-life in Germany, their acute and adjuvant medication treatment, events until discharge (e.g. mortality, stroke, re-MI), and their medication for secondary prevention at discharge. In the follow up-period of one year, information is collected concerning events as mortality, stroke, re-MI, coronary interventions (PCI, CABG) and re-hospitalisation. The implementation of guideline-adjusted therapy in hospital everyday-life is reviewed. The usefulness of the European standard for data acquisition in cardiology (CARDS = Cardiology Audit and Registration Standards) is evaluated.
DOC.brief_title: OPTAMI (Optimized Therapy of Acute Myocardial Infarction) - Registry
DOC.criteria: all patients admitted to hospital with an acute STElevation myocardial infarction or with an acute NonSTElevation myocardial infarction, both not older than 24 h missing informed consent
